review.title: “Easy to hire, easy to fire”
review.pros: Pros – free lunch. hiring process is quite easy because they are almost always under-manned. They are always willing to train you, so it's good for people fresh out of college.
review.cons: Cons – non-existent benefits, high turnover rate, promotion/pay based on how many years you've spent in the company instead of merit. Senior managers should stop slacking and need to do WORK.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Many employees are VERY dissatisfied with the management. reduce the work hours, give us with better benefits (insurance, 401k, etc.), and more vacation days!!

review.title: “umm.. depends how u think”

review.cons: Cons – Literally, 0 benefits. (no insurance, no 401k no everything) 50working hours plus you have work on Sat twice a month. No overtime payment. If you have a family, you won't have lots to time to spend with your family!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I want the company to know that without hard working workers, Hmart couldn't have made this far. I think it's time for Hmart to step back and give back all the efforts and sacrifice of workers in the last 30 years.

review.title: “A lot of work.”
review.pros: Pros – Probably one of the best reasons to work at Hmart is that they give you plenty of hours if you are willing to work them. Applying for the job was relatively quick and I got started a week later. It was also nice building relationships with regular customers and I found that the customer service aspect was quite enjoyable at times. The workers there are nice also and are one of the few reasons why I found it tolerable to work at Hmart.
review.cons: Cons – The job itself ranges from very exhausting to very boring. It can get very busy during upcoming holidays and weekends but can die down pretty quickly near closing. Breaks are very short as you are allowed one 30 minute break during a shift. Work standards are pretty strict and regimental as well. The worst is the amount of pay you earn in proportion to the number of hours you work there. Though you can receive quite a bit of income from a college student's perspective, the number of hours and sometimes overtime hours you must work does not offset the low pay. Also the customers can be extremely rude and difficult to deal with at times. Mishaps do not go unnoticed by supervisors and management.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay the workers more and reduce their hours. Better pay equals happier workers.
